image.altText: A woman in chef's attire.

props.synopsis: A man accused of killing his 85-year-old wife at their home in Adelaide's west has been committed to the state's highest court to stand trial, despite not entering a plea to murder.

title.children: Family 'disappointed and distraught' after accused wife killer granted bail

image.altText: In a sequence of images, a young Indigenous teen is held down and struck with a baton by police.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has obtained footage showing police beating an Indigenous youth repeatedly with a baton in a watch house, sparking allegations of excessive use of force.

title.children: CCTV footage shows Queensland police beating teenager with a baton in watch house

image.altText: Filicide study

props.synopsis: About 20 children are murdered by a parent every year in Australia. It's a crime that evokes equal measures of horror and confusion. At the crux of the issue is male perpetrated violence.

title.children: 'The ultimate form of revenge': The psychology behind acts of filicide

image.altText: The exterior of the Christies Beach Magistrates Court in Adelaide's south.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man is alleged to have deliberately set fire to a southern suburbs home while a woman and her three children were inside on Sunday — just hours after three children perished in an unrelated house fire in Sydney.

title.children: SA man accused of setting fire to house while woman, three children were inside

image.altText: A composite image of a large penguin on a beach

props.synopsis: While the presence of two sizeable pieces of plastic in the bird's stomach were concerning, its cause of death was most likely a dog or fox attack.

title.children: King penguin's rare SA sojourn ends in animal attack

image.altText: A red ute stuck on the side of a sandy embankment.

props.synopsis: Four-wheel driving is getting more popular, but some in the industry say inexperienced drivers may be putting themselves in danger.

title.children: Rescuer worried about inexperienced drivers tackling difficult terrain in 4WDs

image.altText: A woman with grey hair wearing a check jacket and pearls

props.synopsis: South Australia's anti-corruption commissioner has quit saying she has "run out of steam" after the state's integrity laws were watered down nearly three years ago.

title.children: 'My words have fallen on deaf ears': ICAC boss quits after reforms 'damaged' SA's integrity scheme

image.altText: People walking past a Westpac sign.

props.synopsis: Privacy laws are restricting banks' abilities to effectively deal with cases of financial abuse, Australia's second-largest bank has told a federal inquiry.

title.children: Privacy laws preventing bank from adequately addressing financial abuse, Westpac representatives say

image.altText: A bespectacled man with a grey goatee wears a blue top as he sits with his arms on a table in front of him.

props.synopsis: Within a year of landing her first full-time teaching job, the 26-year-old took her own life after overzealous parents ruthlessly scrutinised her performance and threatened to make criminal complaints to the police.

title.children: Oh Jae Geun's daughter was a budding young teacher but relentless pressure from pushy school parents drove her to suicide

image.altText: New research examines prevalence of sexual violence perpetration in Australia

props.synopsis: A new study finds "shocking" levels of perpetrating sexual violence among Australians aged 18 to 45, with men the main offenders.

title.children: 1 in 5 Australians admit to perpetrating acts of sexual violence, from harassing someone for a date to sexual assault

image.altText: A woman with her three children sitting in playground.

props.synopsis: Bianca Dannenberg-Turner was asked to pay a gap fee before a doctor would see her two-year-old son, who arrived at Clare Hospital via ambulance with a perforated ear drum.

title.children: Mum asked to pay fee before toddler could be treated at regional SA hospital

image.altText: Two men walking away from the NT Local Court.

props.synopsis: Neil Mellon has been sentenced to eight months behind bars after pleading guilty to a string of offences, including destroying evidence related to a 2022 helicopter crash that killed Netflix star Chris ‘Willow’ Wilson.

title.children: Former NT police officer jailed for destroying evidence after chopper crash that killed Netflix star

image.altText: Pilot's view of the cockpit in plane, looking out at mountainous landscape, instruments on dash

props.synopsis: From a country boy to a firefighting pilot facing unfamiliar mountain saddles rippled with turbulence and a scrambled GPS — it's an aviation career not for the faint-hearted, but Tony Warren was born for it.

title.children: The Aussie pilots swapping crop spraying for international firefighting

image.altText: Man in dirty Sydney Swans uniform rests hands on hips

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans' Isaac Heeney is ineligible for the Brownlow Medal after failing to overturn his one-game ban at the AFL tribunal.

title.children: Brownlow contender Isaac Heeney fails to overturn ban

image.altText: A split screen image of damage in Israel and a woman in southern Lebanon

props.synopsis: An Israeli town 1 kilometre from the Lebanon border is all but deserted as the threat of a new war looms. Inside Lebanon, residents are also preparing for a full-scale conflict.

title.children: Thousands of strikes across the Lebanon-Israel border put the region on alert for a new war

image.altText: Chinese flags fly high outside the Australian Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia and key regional partners are accusing a Chinese spy agency of cyber espionage targeting government and business networks, in a large-scale operation that involves stealing hundreds of usernames and passwords.

title.children: Australia takes lead for first time in pushback against Chinese hacking

image.altText: Two power workers in a cherry picker work to repair a power pole.

props.synopsis: Entrenched opposition between electrical workers and NSW transmission owner Transgrid is taking a toll on a strained power market.

title.children: Renewable connections stalled, prices rising as the fallout from a bitter industrial power fight spreads

image.altText: A woman speaks in an outdoor setting.

props.synopsis: Recognising a rise in Jewish people in Australia being targeted after the October 7 Hamas terror attack, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese appoints Jillian Segal as the first special envoy for anti-Semitism.

title.children: Prime minister names Jillian Segal as first Australian anti-Semitism envoy

image.altText: Dirty money house 2

props.synopsis: The Australian government's efforts to crack down on money laundering is facing resistance from certain professions, but failing to do so is leaving the nation well behind the global fight against these financial crimes.

title.children: Can the government beat the real estate industry in its money laundering crackdown?

image.altText: Dozens of people holding up the roof of a building crumbling down after a missile strike

props.synopsis: Msocow has claimed a Kyiv children's hospital was hit by Ukrainian anti-missile fire, not a Russian missile, during daylight attacks that killed 41 people across the country.

title.children: 'Horrific reminder of Russia's brutality': Kyiv children's hospital bombed as strikes kill dozens across Ukraine

image.altText: An aerial shot of a typical Australian suburban neighbourhood

props.synopsis: The latest Rental Pain Index provides a monthly snapshot of conditions for renters, revealing signs of easing stress in some areas but high costs remain a critical issue affecting households nationwide.

title.children: How 'painful' is your suburb? These are Australia's worst areas to be a renter

image.altText: West Coast Eagles coach Adam Simpson

props.synopsis: Eagles coach Adam Simpson will leave West Coast after weeks of pressure on his leadership, with the club saying they have mutually agreed his 11-year tenure will come to an end.

title.children: Adam Simpson gone as West Coast Eagles coach after more than a decade at helm

image.altText: A man of south Asian heritage in a blue suit, walking about of a courtroom

props.synopsis: A man accused of setting up a sham company used to steal $1.7 million from Australian scam victims has admitted in court to deleting crucial messages.

title.children: He's alleged to have set up a sham company to steal $1.7m. Now he's having his day in court

image.altText: A frying pan sits on a city street, with an egg inside it.

props.synopsis: Four people were reported dead in the Portland area and one at Death Valley, California, due to the gripping heat.

title.children: A searing heat wave has gripped the US, leaving five dead in California and Oregon

image.altText: A person in an orange jumpsuit and black helmet leans over a person on a stretcher.

props.synopsis: Nearly 400 people have been involved in the search, including police, military, and rescuers using helicopters.

title.children: The search is on for dozens buried in an Indonesian landslide which killed 17 people

image.altText: A young woman holding a baby whose face has been blurred. A man sits next to them.

props.synopsis: A former legal secretary has told the Supreme Court that missing NSW woman Amber Haigh believed her "life would be taken" by Robert Geeves after she gave birth.

title.children: Murder trial hears Amber Haigh made a will as she feared the father of her child would 'end her life'

image.altText: a small electric car plugged in to an electric charger inside a garage

props.synopsis: A new report reveals power from a small number of electric vehicle batteries in Canberra was used to respond to a blackout in Victoria, and experts believe this could be done on a much larger scale.

title.children: In a world-first, Australian electric vehicles have fed the national power grid during an outage

image.altText: A woman wearing a black hoodie sat on grass

props.synopsis: Jeremaia Tuwai, 21, was arrested yesterday after a woman was allegedly stabbed in the chest at an apartment complex at Kingswood in Western Sydney.

title.children: Man charged with murder after 21yo woman killed in alleged domestic violence stabbing in Sydney's west

image.altText: A humpback whale is freed from trawler wire near Iluka on the NSW north coast.

props.synopsis: A 'hand-picked' team of divers braved big swells to free a humpback whale pinned to the ocean floor off the NSW North Coast.

title.children: Juvenile humpback was 'anchored to sea floor' by a wire cable for 8 days before dramatic rescue

image.altText: A white man in his 30s or 40s with short brown hair and a cropped beard, wearing a grey T-shirt.

props.synopsis: Being a dad never felt like an option for me. Being a sperm donor has opened that door. One of the most painful things in my life was understanding very young that it'd be nearly impossible for me to have kids.

title.children: I have 5 biological children I have never met. I hope they feel loved

image.altText: Generic photos of apartments, balconies

props.synopsis: Australian home values grew by 8 per cent in the past financial year. Here's a breakdown of how much you need to be earning to afford a property at the median value in your capital city.

title.children: Here's how much you need to earn to afford a mid-range home in your capital city

image.altText: Jarome Luai rescued from drowning at wave pool

props.synopsis: Jarome Luai survives a major scare after a fearless response to a dare from his NSW teammates almost ended on catastrophic circumstances.

title.children: 'I almost died out there': Luai rescued from drowning after dare gone wrong during Origin recovery session

image.altText: A close up of women cheering in the street as a French flag waves in the air behind them

props.synopsis: From surprise swings to new leaders, resignations and campaign speculation, there's been a lot happening in terms of international elections. Here's a quick recap of the latest updates.

title.children: French deadlock, UK elects record number of women – your quick recap of recent elections around the world

image.altText: Composite image of Brigid Cook, left, and Amy Roganovic as a child in 1996.

props.synopsis: Amy Roganovic's family was heading back to the Broad Arrow Cafe when they heard the sound of gunshots. It was a warning from one of the staff that sent them running.

title.children: Brigid's 'wild' warning that helped save Amy's family during the Port Arthur massacre

image.altText: Adam Britton stands by greenery wearing a green shirt

props.synopsis: Adam Britton, celebrated as a world-renowned crocodile expert and zoologist, was arrested and remanded in custody in 2022. He has pleaded guilty to 60 charges of bestiality, animal cruelty and possessing child abuse material.

title.children: How an 'unassuming' crocodile expert shocked a community with horrific dog crimes
